channel.title: How server.java initialises
channel.description:
well thanks to i vain i completely ive actually managed to learn quite abit about servers(317), anyways i looked over the main method in server.java and this is what i see its doing (tell me if im wrong and correct me please).
btw: i dled a delta base to look at the server.java, so this is deltas server.java...
----------- 1st. a new file is declared, that being server.ini.
2nd. the server's properties are parsed into ints.
3rd. the client is checked if its the right one.
4th. the server constructor is called in...a thread? im not sure, heres the code..
[code]clientHandler = new server(); (new Thread(clientHandler)).start(); // launch server listener[/code]
5. a crap load of files are initialised.
6. thats as far as ive come to because the server const. is empty, so i dont get it, where is the cache & mapdata & 3d models used/loaded?

item.title: How server.java initialises
item.dc:creator: @frozon566 frozon566
item.description:
@frozon566 wrote:

well thanks to i vain i completely ive actually managed to learn quite abit about servers(317), anyways i looked over the main method in server.java and this is what i see its doing (tell me if im wrong and correct me please).

btw: i dled a delta base to look at the server.java, so this is deltas server.java…

1st. a new file is declared, that being server.ini.

2nd. the server’s properties are parsed into ints.

3rd. the client is checked if its the right one.

4th. the server constructor is called in…a thread? im not sure, heres the code…

clientHandler = new server(); (new Thread(clientHandler)).start(); // launch server listener

  1. a crap load of files are initialised.

  2. thats as far as ive come to because the server const. is empty, so i dont get it, where is the cache & mapdata & 3d models used/loaded?
